alert.note: Alert for Boone; Kanawha; Lincoln; Logan; Mingo (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 16 at 6:03PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Mingo, south central Kanawha, southern Lincoln, northwestern Logan and Boone Counties through 630 PM EST... At 602 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Chapmanville, or 9 miles northwest of Logan, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Madison, Logan, Chesapeake, Belle, Chapmanville, Van, Mount Gay-Shamrock, Harts, Chief Logan State, Gill, Julian, Holden, Danville, Whitesville, West Logan, Mitchell Heights, Sylvester, Seth, Turtle Creek and Dawes. This includes the following highways... West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 77 and 88. Route 119 between mile markers 26 and 59. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Flash Flood Watch remains in effect. Heavy downpours could cause rapid rises in water. If rising water is observed, move to higher ground. Do not drive into areas covered by water. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground.
